title: What are the salient features of Consumer Protection Act, 1986? - Quora

response.answer_text: The Act introduces the establishment of a Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) by the central government. The CCPA is a regulatory authority and shall be empowered to impose penalties, recall goods, cause withdrawal of services, provide refunds and investigate into matters. A state or federal law designed to protect consumers against improperly described, damaged, faulty, and dangerous goods and services as well as from unfair trade and credit practices.

The salient features of Consumer Protection Act are: i) It enshrines six rights of consumers. ii) The provision of the act are in addition to other laws. iii) It covers all goods and services. iv) Defines Goods and Services. v) The Act covers all sectors. vi) The act seeks redressal of consumers complaint in a timely and inexpensive manner.
